column4: Question: does anyone have an idea as to why certain web pages will NOT begin to load in linux, but will in windows? (same machine, same firefox, etc)
i can't even wget a png file from this webserver in linux, but i can in windows
Only certain pages though?
yes and all part of Ohio State University servers
Mark_G http://www.ureg.ohio-state.edu/ourweb/more/Content/Important_dates/SP08_Important_dates.htm there is one that wont work right now
are you quite sure the problem is on _your_ end?
Mark_G http://fod.osu.edu/2008/library_path_alternate.png there is the PNG just to make it simpler
no but i dont know how to continue diagnosing
It doesn't load for me either, not on Ubuntu right now.  Not your problem.
call up the admin and tell them it's down...
what OS? it will load for me on this exact same machine if i boot in windows
Mac 10.5
the admin will say "what OS are you using? sorry we dont support that"
You never answer that question.
hehehe
im just stumped as to what could possibly be making the difference, when i cant even wget the stupid png

Most likely you have the DNS information cached in Windows b/c you've visited the site before, and don't have it cached in Ubuntu, and the DNS servers are down/incorrect right now.  If you flush the DNS info in XP, it will probably fail there too.
it has never worked in linux though, and i rebooted into windows and it worked the very first time i encountered this. also it has never hung in windows
i tried using the useragent thing in firefox but to no avail figured that might be it

eh, just call 'em up and say it's broken in everything.  If it doesn't load for your Ubuntu or anyone else here, it's clearly a problem on their end regardless of what the problem is.  Someone is being paid for this - make them do it.
hehe well if it doesnt work in macOS then i can always lie and say im using that, if they press me
sure thing
